channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Many Americans say the U.S. is not a moral leader but want it to be: NPR/Ipsos poll
item.description: Commissioned by NPR in December in partnership with Ipsos, the share of people who believe the U.S. is a moral leader dropped to 39% from 60% in a sim...

item.title: Wary of Investing in Venezuela, Big Oil Heads to the White House
item.description: The amounts of money, time and political uncertainty trouble executives at large Western oil companies, who plan to meet with President Trump on Frida...

item.title: The War Over the Weedkiller Roundup Might Be Headed to the Supreme Court
item.description: Bayer has asked the justices to decide whether federal law shields the company from lawsuits over its Roundup herbicide and cancer. Democrats and MAHA...

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Says Protests Are Happening to ‘Please’ Trump
item.description: After days of fierce protest in cities around Iran, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei dismissed the demonstrations as vandalism and wanton destruction.

item.title: We're going to the Olympics! What do you want to know?
item.description: Here's how to send your questions and curiosities to the NPR team covering the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Maduro is out, Congress is in and the quiz is back! Start 2026 with a perfect score
item.description: Plus: What's up with Wicked , Greenland, quarters and Jan. 6?

item.title: What to Know About the Latest Jobs Report
item.description: Data on the labor market in December will be closely watched for clues on the state of the economy.

item.title: The Golden Globes are this weekend. Hear from some of the nominees
item.description: The Golden Globe are Sunday night. Revisit some of the nominees that have appeared on NPR's "Morning Edition" this past year.

item.title: Your next primary care doctor could be online only, accessed through an AI tool
item.description: The shortage of primary care doctors is a national problem. To cope, a large health system in Massachusetts is using an AI tool to screen patients and...

item.title: Why Many Republican Voters Support Trump’s Use of Force in Venezuela
item.description: They don’t like nation building, but they do want to project American power.

item.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Says Protests Are Happening to ‘Please’ Trump
item.description: After days of fierce protest in cities around Iran, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei dismissed the demonstrations as vandalism and wanton destruction.

item.title: Venezuela Updates: Senate Advances Measure to Curb Trump’s Use of Force

item.title: Runway Wall Caused All the Deaths in 2024 South Korean Plane Crash, Report Says

item.title: How an Abrupt Call Between Trump and Colombia’s President Averted a Crisis
item.description: President Gustavo Petro said that the new tone between the leaders was “friendly,” but he also resurfaced his deep disagreements with President Trump.
